titleInfo.title: Brenda and Isaac Patterson Jr. oral history interview

subject.geographic: Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church (Baton Rouge, La.)

mods.abstract: The Pattersons talk about their family background and upbringing and the role of religion in their lives. They share their experiences as member of Shiloh Baptist Church. They talk about church membership, traditions, leadership, inclusiveness, and activities in the community. They discuss their involvement with Shiloh's family ministry, the organization and leadership of that ministry, and its importance in supporting parishioners.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.0843; A digital version of the transcript (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Tayari Kwa Salaam.

Brenda Rosea Patterson was born in Pineville, La., and raised in Baton Rouge. She is a graduate of Delta Business College and works as the minister's secretary at Greater New Guide Baptist Church. She has been a member of Shiloh Baptist Church for fifteen years and is a member of Shiloh's family ministry.; Isaac Patterson Jr., Brenda's husband, was born in New Orleans and also raised in Baton Rouge. He is a graduate of McKinley Senior High and attended Southern University for two years. He works as an operator at Dow Chemical Company. He is also a member of the family ministry at Shiloh Baptist Church.
